A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The movie was a ratty\, tatty patchwork mess the pace was the equivalent of sitting in a car being driven by a learner behind the wheel of a stick shift manual\, lurching forward & stalling then restarting the car\, lurching over & over:  the side stories were agonizing to sit through like a trip to the dentist\, i oddly found myself sitting in the cinema wishing i had a remote control to fast forward them: there was so much hype that my expectations were raised high but were flattened at the reality of the experience: i found the new characters boring\, like shallow projections i found no reason to relate to. The kylo ren snoke kill scene was abrupt & poorly executed & felt as unsatisfying to watch as a fighter jet pilot bombing afghani civillians on the ground through a grey night vision screen: we were all being fed so many false tidbits leading up to tlj release which were unfortunately better than the actual movie. Im sure disney throws out a bunch of disinfo before the release to throw people off but it just left me expecting so much more than was delivered. I left the cinema asking what just happened? & being unable to find any closure because nothing really happened. It was a perplexing mess. Dont waste your money on this one wait for it to come out on dvd. Its a sad disappointment.
